pronunciation: TRAV'AIL, [Latin trans, over, beyond, and mael, work; Eng. moil.]

definitions.text:
Travail
 [Latin trans, over, beyond, and mael, work; Eng. moil.]
1. To labor with pain; to toil.
2. To suffer the pangs of childbirth; to be in labor. Genesis 35:16.TRAV'AIL,
To harass; to tire; as troubles sufficient to travail the realm. [Not in use.]

Labor with pain; severe toil.As every thing of price, so doth this require travail
1. Labor in childbirth; as severe travail; an easy travail
